page.title: 01Farmland around Weston Heath
page.content:
The land falls from a sandstone ridge in the west to an undulating area in the east. The farming landscape is broken up by woods and coppices. From Heath Hill are extensive views westwards to Wales across Shropshire, and to Cannock Chase in the east.
A large lake - the White Sytch, lies in the SE. It is surrounded by private woodland where pheasants breed. The A41 bisects the block. The land to the west is sloping pasture land, while to the east is mixed farmland crossed by high-hedged lanes. Sugar beet, Kale and cereals are grown here. Part of the village of Sheriffhales lies in the SW corner, and other areas of housing are found at Heath Hill and Great Chatwell. Farms and cottages are scattered over
